p: Actinomycetes were isolated by spreading dilutions of soil samples on petri dishes using Gao’s No. 1 medium (20 g of soluble starch, 1 g of KNO 3, 0.5 g of K 2HPO 4, 0.5 g of MgSO 4⋅7H 2O, 0.5 g of NaCl, 0.01 g of FeSO 4⋅7H 2O, 20 g of agar, pH 7.2 – 7.4). The media also contained 25 μg/mL potassium dichromate to minimize bacterial and fungal contamination ( Xu et al., 1996). All the plates were incubated at 20°C ± 1 for 30 days.
